Constructor Detail

GameGrid

public GameGrid(int dimension)
Constructor initializes the variables and arrays for other methods, attempts to create a grid tries at most 50 times, takes the best grid and uses it for the puzzle.

Parameters:
dimension - The dimensions of a sudoku grid, i.e. 9 = 9x9 grid
Method Detail

setNumber

public void setNumber(java.lang.Integer x,
                      java.lang.Integer y,
                      java.lang.Integer number)
Changes the specified number in the "givens" array

Parameters:
x - The column position of the number
y - The row position of the number
number - The number to be inserted into the array

setNumber

public void setNumber(java.lang.Integer number)
Sets the currently selected number

Parameters:
number - The number to set to

create

public boolean create(int[][] grid_,
                      boolean[][] box,
                      boolean[][] row,
                      boolean[][] column,
                      int level)
Method attempts to create a solvable grid

Parameters:
grid_ - The 2d array that will hold the puzzle
box - 2d boolean array of a 3x3 box
row - 2d boolean array of possible values at for the row
column - 2d boolean array of possible values at for the column
level - Starting difficulty of the puzzle
Returns:
If true is returned then a puzzle has been successfully made, otherwise it hasn't.

solvable

private int solvable()
Method validates whether or not the grid is solvable

Returns:
An integer is returned representing the difficulty of the puzzle, if it is not solvable 0 is returned

private int solvableNormal()

private int solvableHard()

permutateList

private int[] permutateList()
Helps to make the grid more random

Returns:
List of numbers 1-9
